phrases.usage: Use this to share your general daily schedule with others.
phrases.example: I usually wake up at seven in the morning.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain the next step in your routine.
phrases.example: Then I drink a cup of hot black coffee.

phrases.usage: Use this to move to a different morning activity smoothly.
phrases.example: After that, I eat a very healthy breakfast bowl.

phrases.usage: Use this to tell someone your specific departure time clearly.
phrases.example: I leave home at eight to catch the fast train.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe your preferred mode of transport daily.
phrases.example: I go to the office by a crowded blue bus.

phrases.usage: Use this to state the duration of your morning commute.
phrases.example: It takes twenty minutes to reach the big city center.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention when your work or classes begin.
phrases.example: I start at eight thirty every busy Monday morning.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention a final task before leaving home.
phrases.example: Before school, I check my heavy bag for my books.

keyVocabulary.definition: Happening or done before the usual or expected time.
Having a lot of things to do every day.
Moving fast or doing something in a short time.
Needing rest or sleep after a long morning routine.
Prepared and able to leave for work or school.
